activities.loc: Richland County Courtroom, Floor C, Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
3:38 PM Defendant Jeremy E Monroe in court.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson in court for Jeremy E Monroe.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Parties states the joint agreement to enter a plea on count 1 and 3 without the repeater and order a PSI. All other cases DRI. Court goes over the colloquy. Court finds a factual basis. JM enters a NC plea. 

Court DRI: count 2, 4, 5, 6 and 7.

Court orders a PSI on count 1 and 3.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 5, 2023 at 11:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on January 5, 2023 at 11:00 am.

1:14 PM Defendant Jeremy E Monroe in court.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson in court for Jeremy E Monroe.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Erickson comments. Atty Harper responds, gives recommended resolution reached between parties. Atty Harper will be submitting an amended information. 
Victim comments- wants to have this settled today.
Court can put on for a plea hearing today at 3:45pm and informs parties there would be no sentencing today. Parties in agreement.
Plea hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
Plea hearing on October 31, 2022 at 03:45 pm.

1:17 PM Defendant Jeremy E Monroe in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson in court for Jeremy E Monroe.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Harper explains what has happen to this case due to another counties disposition. Attorney Erickson asks for more time. Attorney Harper asks for a final status on Friday.
Final status/scheduling conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Final status/scheduling conference on October 31, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

2:03 PM Defendant Jeremy E Monroe appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson in court for Jeremy E Monroe.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Court speaks that we are hearing on a scheduling conference. Attorney Erickson states the he has file a bond motion. Attorney Erickson ask for a $500 cash bond instead of a $10,000 cash bond. Defendant states that his father has passed away.  Attorney Harper comments and notes that the victim has a bail reduction. Attorney Harper object the bond motion to reduce the bond. Attorney Harper speaks about the speedy jury trial demand that has been filed in this case with Attorney Frank. JM comments about his fathers funeral and notes that there will be a ceremony. Attorney Harper would like to see the paper work that JM is referencing. Court denies modification of bail. Court states that when JM knows when the funeral will be then the court will reconsider it. Attorney Erickson asks when the amended information will be filed. Attorney Harper states that she can do that today. 

Court asks how long would a trial be in this case. Attorney Harper states two days. Attorney Erickson concurs. Attorney Harper asks for a pick and go. Court agrees that this will be a pick and go.
Jury trial scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

12:59 PM Defendant Jeremy E Monroe in court.  Attorney Mark Walter Frank in court for Jeremy E Monroe.  Attorney Forehand on behalf of  Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Frank stand mute on behalf of his client. Court advise the clerk to enter a NG plea. 

Attorney Frank enters a demand for a speedy trial. Attorney Frank speaks about bond, states he can't post $10,000 and medical issues the defendant is having.  Court denies the motion to modify bond. Attorney Forehand suggest 2 days. Attorney Frank agrees with 2 days. Court will set this case for a two day trial.
Final pre-trial scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury selection scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Frank speaks about the current $10,000 cash bond. The victim address the court about bond. Attorney Harper speaks about bond and object to the lower cash bond or signature bond. Court denies the motion to change the cash bond.

Attorney Frank waives the time limits.

State asks that the bond be converted to 10,000 signature bond until Noon on May 13, 2022 and after that time be converted back to a cash bond.

1:01 PM Defendant Jeremy E Monroe in court in custody.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. JM confirms address of 400 N Web, Reedsburg, WI. Max penalties stated. JM has tried to speak to the public defenders office but didn't get anyone. Defendant has left a message.

State speaks about bond and asks for $10,000 cash bond with condition of no contact with victim 1 or her residence. JM states that he just started a job today on Tuesday, April 26, 2022. JM state that he hasn't missed any court appearances. State looks up the defendants appearance record. Court orders 10,000 cash bond with condition of no contact with victim 1.
